entry.title: How to honor those we lost in the 44-day war

media:group.media:title: How to honor those we lost in the 44-day war
media:group.media:description:
In the latest edition of Insights With Eric Hacopian, Eric reflected on the 44-day war and how people can support the families of fallen and injured soldiers. Eric also examined why the war didnโt actually end in 2020, the goals of the regime in Baku, and the importance of building a โgarrison stateโ in Armenia.

ิฒึีตีธึีฝีฅีฌีธึีด ีฟีฅีฒีกีฏีกีตีพีกีฎ ีีซีปีกีฆีฃีกีตีซีถ ีณีฃีถีกีชีกีดีกีตีซีถ ีญีธึีดีข (International Crisis Group โ ICG) ีฐีฅีฟีกีฆีธีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีฏีฅีถีฟึีธีถีจ ีฐีกึึีธึีบีกีฟีกีฝีญีกีถ-ีฆีฅีฏีธึีตึ ีง ีฐึีกีบีกึีกีฏีฅีฌ ีฝีฅีบีฟีฅีดีขีฅึีซ 13-14-ีซีถ ีฐีกีต-ีกีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีกีฏีกีถ ีฝีกีฐีดีกีถีซีถ ีฟีฅีฒีซ ีธึีถีฅึีกีฎ ีขีกีญีธึีดีถีฅึีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถึ ิถีฅีฏีธึีตึีซ ีฐีฅีฒีซีถีกีฏีถีฅึีจ ีถีทีธึีด ีฅีถ ีฐีถีกึีกีพีธึ ีบีกีฟีณีกีผีถีฅึีจ, ีฉีฅ ีซีถีนีธึ ีง ิฑีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีจ ีฐีซีดีก ีฝึีธึีด ีซึีกีพีซีณีกีฏีจึ

entry.title: France, UK, US call on Azerbaijan to pull back from Armenian territory

media:group.media:title: France, UK, US call on Azerbaijan to pull back from Armenian territory
media:group.media:description:
Armen Grigoryan, Armeniaโs Security Council head, and Hikmet Hajiyev, a senior assistant to Azerbaijanโs president, met yesterday at the White with U.S. National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan.
France, the United Kingdom, and the United States have separately called on Azerbaijani forces to return to their initial positions after launching a major attack on Armenia earlier this month.
Former Armenian President Robert Kocharyan said during a press conference that it would be โabsurdโ to expect Russia or the Collective Security Treaty Organization to intervene militarily in the region.

entry.title: Can Armenia make do without Russia? A conversation with Ron Suny

media:group.media:title: Can Armenia make do without Russia? A conversation with Ron Suny
media:group.media:description:
Professor Ronald Grigor Suny spoke with CivilNet Editor-in-Chief Karen Harutyunyan, analyzing the current state of affairs in the Caucasus and around and comparing them with developments from a century ago.
Ronald Grigor Suny is Professor of History and Political Science at the University of Michigan and Emeritus Professor of Political Science and History at the University of Chicago. He is the author of more than 20 books on Russia and the Soviet Union.
0:00 - In Ukraine, Russiaโs rise โ or demise? 6:18 - Can Armenia make do without Russia? 9:21 - Will Russia seek to reassert itself in the Caucasus? 15:23 - Russia-Turkey relations: now and 100 years ago. 20:00 - How should Armenia approach Russia in a volatile geopolitical climate? 24:22 - How can Armenia turn its soft power into hard power?
